input.concept: Loan Orchestration Platform for SMB teams in Global, targeting enterprise operations with emphasis on automation and insights.
input.requirements_yaml:
title: Loan Platform
description: Loan Orchestration Platform for SMB teams in Global, targeting enterprise
  operations with emphasis on automation and insights.
functional_requirements:
- id: FR001
  description: Allow users to plan capacity with contextual guidance
  priority: Medium
- id: FR002
  description: Provide analytics on appointments including trends and anomalies
  priority: Medium
- id: FR003
  description: Integrate with SAP to synchronize data
  priority: Medium
- id: FR004
  description: Offer role-based workspaces for field teams
  priority: Medium
non_functional_requirements:
- id: NFR001
  description: WCAG AA accessibility compliance
  priority: Medium
- id: NFR002
  description: 99.9% uptime during business hours
  priority: High
- id: NFR003
  description: Response time <500ms for key APIs
  priority: High
constraints:
- id: C001
  description: Must deploy on existing Kubernetes clusters
  priority: High
- id: C002
  description: Follow regional data residency requirements
  priority: Medium
meta:
  original_request: Loan Orchestration Platform for SMB teams in Global, targeting
    enterprise operations with emphasis on automation and insights.

output.product_vision:
product_name: Loan Operations Cockpit
product_summary: A cloud‑based loan orchestration platform that streamlines end‑to‑end
  lending processes for small to medium businesses (SMBs) across global markets, focusing
  on automation of workflow steps and providing actionable insights into credit risk
  and operational efficiency.
target_users:
- Loan officers and portfolio managers in SMB banking teams who need to automate application
  workflows, manage customer data, and generate real‑time risk analytics without manual
  intervention.
value_proposition:
- Accelerates decision‑making by automating repetitive tasks such as data validation,
  scoring calculations, and eligibility checks.
- Provides real‑time visibility into loan performance metrics enabling proactive monitoring
  of credit health and operational bottlenecks.
key_capabilities:
- Automated workflow orchestration for application processing, underwriting, servicing,
  and exit stages.
- Real‑time analytics dashboard visualizing KPIs across the lifecycle of SMB loans,
  from origination to repayment.
- Role‑based access control ensuring users only see relevant data while maintaining
  security standards.
non_goals:
- Full integration with enterprise ERP systems beyond native APIs (e.g., SAP).
- End‑to‑end regulatory compliance; requires external validation and governance processes.
success_metrics:
- Reduce manual entry time for loan application fields by >30% within the first quarter
  of deployment.
- Achieve real‑time analytics visibility into loan performance metrics with <5 minutes
  latency from data ingestion to dashboard updates.
last_updated: 2025-09-03 00:00:00+00:00
output.product_owner_review:
status: aligned
summary:
- The requirements directly support the product vision by emphasizing automation,
  real‑time analytics, and role‑based access for SMB loan operations.
requirements_alignment:
  aligned:
  - FR001: Aligns with automated workflow orchestration capabilities.
  - FR002: Supports real‑time analytics dashboard functionality.
  - FR004: Ensures role‑based workspaces meet the vision’s emphasis on tailored user
      experiences without compromising security.
  gaps:
  - No requirement explicitly mentions compliance or regulatory constraints, which
    are noted as non‑goals in the vision.
  conflicts:
  - FR003 (integration with SAP) contradicts the explicit exclusion of full ERP integration
    beyond native APIs mentioned in the product vision.
recommended_actions:
- Clarify that SAP integration is limited to native API connectivity only; remove
  any reference to “synchronize data” with SAP as a separate requirement.
narrative: The requirements are generally aligned with the existing product vision,
  except for the SAP integration point which should be removed or re‑scoped to reflect
  the non‑goal of end‑to‑end ERP integration. All other capabilities and constraints
  match the envisioned platform for SMB loan orchestration.

input.concept: Talent Onboarding Console for startups teams in Global, targeting medium operations with emphasis on automation and insights.
input.requirements_yaml:
title: Talent Platform
description: Talent Onboarding Console for startups teams in Global, targeting medium
  operations with emphasis on automation and insights.
functional_requirements:
- id: FR001
  description: Allow users to launch campaigns with contextual guidance
  priority: Medium
- id: FR002
  description: Provide analytics on appointments including trends and anomalies
  priority: High
- id: FR003
  description: Integrate with SAP to synchronize data
  priority: Medium
- id: FR004
  description: Offer role-based workspaces for field teams
  priority: Medium
non_functional_requirements:
- id: NFR001
  description: Data encrypted at rest (AES-256) and in transit (TLS1.2)
  priority: Medium
- id: NFR002
  description: 99.9% uptime during business hours
  priority: Medium
- id: NFR003
  description: Response time <500ms for key APIs
  priority: High
constraints:
- id: C001
  description: Integrate with corporate SSO (SAML/OIDC)
  priority: High
- id: C002
  description: Follow regional data residency requirements
  priority: Medium
meta:
  original_request: Talent Onboarding Console for startups teams in Global, targeting
    medium operations with emphasis on automation and insights.

output.product_vision:
product_name: Talent Onboarding Console
product_summary: A cloud‑based onboarding platform that streamlines employee integration
  processes for global startup teams operating under medium‑scale operations, emphasizing
  automation and actionable insights to accelerate time‑to‑productivity and enhance
  organizational resilience through data‑driven decision making.
target_users:
- HR Operations Managers overseeing onboarding workflows across multiple locations
  within a global startup environment.
value_proposition:
- Accelerates employee integration by automating repetitive tasks such as document
  collection, feedback loops, and progress tracking.
- Provides real‑time visibility into onboarding performance metrics (e.g., task completion
  rates, survey scores) enabling proactive adjustments to improve candidate experience
  and operational efficiency.
key_capabilities:
- Automated campaign orchestration with contextual guidance based on role, geography,
  and cultural nuances.
- Real‑time analytics dashboard visualizing appointment trends, bottlenecks, and anomalies
  across the onboarding lifecycle.
- Role‑based access control for tailored workflows without exposing unnecessary data
  to end users.
non_goals:
- Full integration with enterprise ERP systems beyond native APIs (e.g., SAP).
- End‑to‑end regulatory compliance; requires external validation and governance processes.
success_metrics:
- Reduce onboarding cycle time by >30% within the first quarter of deployment.
- Achieve real‑time analytics visibility into candidate progress metrics with <5 minutes
  latency from data ingestion to dashboard updates.
last_updated: 2025-09-03 00:00:00+00:00
output.product_owner_review:
status: needs_adjustment
summary:
- The product vision and requirements are conceptually aligned around automation,
  analytics, and role‑based access but diverge in scope from the original Fleet Telemetry
  Platform (FTP) which focused on logistics telemetry.
requirements_alignment:
  aligned:
  - NFR001 (Data encrypted at rest and in transit): Consistent with security best
      practices for any cloud platform.
  - NFR003 (API response time <500 ms): Directly supports the real‑time analytics
      requirement.
  gaps:
  - FR001, FR002, and FR003 reference integration points (e.g., SAP) that are not
    part of the original vision or domain. These need clarification on whether they
    refer to a different system within the startup ecosystem or should be scoped out.
  conflicts:
  - The non‑goal "Full integration with enterprise ERP systems beyond native APIs"
    directly contradicts FR003’s requirement for SAP synchronization, indicating a
    potential misalignment unless SAP is not intended as an external ERP but rather
    as a specific data source to be ingested.
recommended_actions:
- Clarify the scope of any integrations referenced (e.g., replace "SAP" with the actual
  system or remove the integration if it’s out‑of‑scope).
- Update FR003 and related constraints to reflect only native SSO protocols and regional
  data residency compliance that align with the onboarding domain.
narrative: The requirements emphasize automation, analytics, and role‑based access
  which are consistent with the envisioned benefits of a Talent Onboarding Console;
  however, integration references (e.g., SAP) need redefinition or removal to ensure
  coherence with the product vision.

input.requirements_yaml:

description: Cross-Border Marketplace for non-profits teams in LATAM, targeting enterprise

functional_requirements:
- id: FR001

  priority: Medium
- id: FR002

  priority: High
- id: FR003
  description: Integrate with Stripe to synchronize data
  priority: Medium
- id: FR004
  description: Offer role-based workspaces for analysts
  priority: Medium
non_functional_requirements:
- id: NFR001
  description: Response time <500ms for key APIs
  priority: High
- id: NFR002
  description: WCAG AA accessibility compliance
  priority: Medium
- id: NFR003
  description: Data encrypted at rest (AES-256) and in transit (TLS1.2)
  priority: High

output.product_vision:
product_name: Cross-Border Marketplace Platform
product_summary: A specialized marketplace enabling non‑profit teams across LATAM
  to automate cross‑border operations while gaining actionable insights and regulatory
  compliance for enterprise logistics.
target_users:
- Enterprise team leaders managing logistics, supply chain, or operational workflows
  within non‑profits in the region.
value_proposition:
- Automates repetitive tasks to reduce manual workload and enhance decision‑making
  speed.
- Delivers real‑time analytics on order trends, anomalies, and performance metrics.
- Ensures compliance with local regulations and provides transparent audit trails
  for cross‑border transactions.
key_capabilities:
- Automated workflow orchestration tailored to enterprise logistics processes.
- Role‑based access controls aligned with non‑profit organizational roles.
- Unified dashboard offering holistic visibility into operational data, compliance
  status, and key performance indicators.
non_goals:
- Integration of external inventory management systems (handled by existing APIs).
- Full financial transaction processing module; the platform will focus on marketplace
  facilitation and analytics only.
success_metrics:
- Decrease in manual task execution time through automation, measured by reduced response
  times for alerts.
- Adoption rate improvements among non‑profit teams using the platform to manage cross‑border
  operations.
last_updated: 2025-12-01 00:00:00+00:00
output.product_owner_review:
status: misaligned
summary:
- The current vision is centered on a Fleet Telemetry Platform for APAC non‑profits,
  which does not align with the new Cross‑Border Marketplace concept targeting LATAM.
requirements_alignment:
  gaps:
  - FR001 (campaign launch with contextual guidance) – no direct relevance to fleet
    telemetry or telematics; requires clarification of how it fits within logistics
    automation.
  - FR002 (analytics on orders, trends, anomalies) – aligns more closely but the platform
    is a marketplace, not an analytics layer for fleet data.
  - FR003 (Stripe integration) – introduces financial transaction processing, conflicting
    with non_goal to avoid full financial module development.
  - FR004 (role‑based workspaces for analysts) – supports role‑based access but may
    be better suited for a separate admin/analytics dashboard rather than integrated
    into the marketplace core.
conflicts:
- Integration requirement (FR003) contradicts the explicit non‑goal of developing
  a full financial transaction processing module, suggesting a need to reframe or
  scope this functionality.
recommended_actions:
- Update product vision to reflect a Cross‑Border Marketplace for LATAM non‑profits
  with automation and insights focus.
- Align functional requirements (e.g., FR001–FR004) with the new domain—remove or
  repurpose those tied to analytics, Stripe integration, and role‑based workspaces
  as they pertain to marketplace operations rather than fleet telemetry.
narrative: The existing vision for a Fleet Telemetry Platform does not match the scope
  of the requested Cross‑Border Marketplace; therefore, adjustments are necessary
  to realign product objectives with the new market concept.

input.concept: Partner Enablement Workspace for university extension programs in North America, targeting corporate operations with emphasis on personalized engagement.
input.requirements_yaml:
title: Partner Enablement Workspace - Personalized Engagement
description: Deliver a partner enablement workspace that helps university extension
  programs tackle personalized engagement by combining workflow automation, shared
  dashboards, and open APIs.
functional_requirements:
- id: FR001
  description: Trigger notifications in Slack/Teams when KPIs deviate from targets.
  priority: Medium
- id: FR002
  description: Provide guided playbooks for personalized engagement with contextual
    checklists.
  priority: Medium
- id: FR003
  description: Support sandbox environments to simulate personalized engagement scenarios
    before go-live.
  priority: Medium
- id: FR004
  description: Allow operators to configure personalized engagement workflows per
    business unit.
  priority: High
non_functional_requirements:
- id: NFR001
  description: Average API response time under 300ms at P95.
  priority: Medium
- id: NFR002
  description: WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility compliance across dashboards.
  priority: High
- id: NFR003
  description: Configurable retention policies to meet GDPR and HIPAA.
  priority: Medium
constraints:
- id: C001
  description: Solution must expose OpenAPI 3.1 compliant documentation.
  priority: Medium
- id: C002
  description: All customer data must remain within regional data centers.
  priority: Medium
meta:
  original_request: Partner Enablement Workspace for university extension programs
    in North America, targeting corporate operations with emphasis on personalized
    engagement.

output.product_vision:
product_name: University Extension Enablement Platform
product_summary: A cloud‑based workspace that empowers university extension partners
  to deliver personalized, high‑value educational services through streamlined workflows
  and data insights.
target_users:
- University extension programs focusing on corporate operations in North America.
value_proposition:
- Enables university extensions to automate engagement processes, route communications,
  and provide real‑time dashboards for KPIs such as program completion rates, customer
  satisfaction scores, and enrollment trends.
- Delivers shared analytics and reporting tools that help partners measure impact
  and tailor offerings per client needs.
key_capabilities:
- Role‑based workflow builders allowing operators to configure personalized engagement
  workflows per business unit or region.
- Open REST/GraphQL APIs enabling secure integration with CRM platforms, learning
  management systems, and customer communication channels.
- Automated notifications via Slack/Teams when KPI thresholds are met or breached.
non_goals:
- Full end‑to‑end legal compliance for individual transactions; focuses on operational
  adherence to service standards.
- Integration with legacy ERP systems that lack API support beyond basic connectivity.
success_metrics:
- Reduce manual engagement tasks by >80 % within the first year of deployment.
- Maintain <2 minutes average latency between system updates and dashboard refreshes,
  ensuring real‑time visibility for partners.
last_updated: 2024-04-05 10:00:00+00:00
output.product_owner_review:
status: aligned
summary:
- The new requirements directly support the expanded product vision centered on university
  extension programs in North America.
requirements_alignment:
  aligned:
  - id: FR001
    description: Trigger notifications in Slack/Teams when KPIs deviate from targets.
  - id: FR004
    description: Allow operators to configure personalized engagement workflows per
      business unit.
  - id: NFR001
    description: Average API response time under 300ms at P95.
  - id: C001
    description: Solution must expose OpenAPI 3.1 compliant documentation.
  - id: C002
    description: All customer data must remain within regional data centers.
  gaps:
  - The vision lacks explicit mention of GDPR and HIPAA compliance, which is now addressed
    by NFR003 but requires further detail on implementation.
  conflicts:
  - None identified; all requirements reinforce the product vision without contradictory
    statements.
recommended_actions:
- Ensure detailed documentation for GDPR/ HIPAA compliance (e.g., data residency policies)
  aligns with operational service standards.
narrative: The updated requirements fully align with the revised product vision, emphasizing
  personalized engagement for university extension partners in North America while
  preserving core capabilities such as workflow automation and API accessibility.
